comments:
Build ID: M20060921-0945

Steps To Reproduce:
I don't think this is directly reproducible, seems more like a concurrency problem. So the described steps only show how I got that Exception

1. start a runtime workbench for plugin developement
2. stop that workbench

More information:

This Exception was thrown while closing the workbench.

Exception in thread "PHP Parser Scheduler" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/php/internal/core/phpModel/phpElementData/PHPFileDataUtilities
	at org.eclipse.php.internal.core.phpModel.parser.DefaultParserClient.getClassName(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.php.internal.core.phpModel.parser.DefaultParserClient.fixObjectInstantiation(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.php.internal.core.phpModel.parser.DefaultParserClient.finishParsing(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.php.internal.core.phpModel.parser.ParserClientComposite.finishParsing(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.php.internal.core.phpModel.parser.ParserExecuter.run(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.php.internal.core.phpModel.parser.PhpParserSchedulerTask.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619)

Johannes,
Thank you for the information, there were many releases after M20060921, specifically we have fixed the scheduler.

You can update your version to a new one, my suggestion: http://download.eclipse.org/tools/pdt/downloads/?release=I20070226
I'm sorry, that was the eclipse build ID. PDT version is 20070221 so I reopen the bug as this version isn't really old.
Can you re-check with latest release?
bug isn't occuring at last few builds
